scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: The papers contain fragments from Life and voyages of Christopher Columbus, A history of New York, Spanish papers, and The Alhambraand incidental notes preliminary to the published works; notes from travels in England; including a description of an evening with the Duke of Wellington and Lady Caroline Lamb; and a comment on contemporary poetry.

did.unittitle: Description of an evening at the home of a Lady B., and several of her guests, the Italian Foscolo, a Belzone, the Duke of Wellington and Lady Caroline Lamb. n.d.
Description of an unnamed abbey, an afternoon service there, and the cloisters at night in London. n.d.
Discussion of a stop at a Welsh inn during a storm, its fine ale and cheese and a harper singing about the exploits of Llewellyn. n.d.
Comments concerning tastes in poetry and predictions about the public reverting back to the conceits, epigrams and metaphysical writing of Queen Anne's reign. n.d.
Incomplete discussion of the case concerning the Spanish slave ship Amistadand the ownership of the ship and cargo following the mutiny of the slaves. n.d.
Notes re events in New Amsterdam, beginning with the arrival of Peter Stuyvesant in 1647. n.d.
